summary: Beth Anne Lichtenfels was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). She is listed in payroll certifications and certification reports from April, August, and December of 1978. These documents detail her employment, annual salary, and gross pay during those periods. The documents do not specify her exact role within the SCAS, but her presence on the payroll indicates she was a staff member.
significance: Beth Anne Lichtenfels' significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating her involvement in the investigation, though her specific role and contributions are not detailed in these documents.
